companie: MSA
intro: Overview Are you someone who is passionate, motivated, and driven to make a difference? If so, MSA Safety is the perfect fit for your career. At MSA, SAFETY is who we are AND it is what we do. We are a purpose-driven company committed to deploying innovation and technology to deliver on our Mission to help protect people and assets all around the world. We continue to be relentless in our pursuit of solving our customers greatest problems so they can go home safe each and every day. Are you in? Read on for more details about this particular role. Responsibilities Correct interpretation of current rules and regulations in Morocco relevant to the customs regimes used (currently temporary admission / ATPA) and subsequent design and / or adjustment of relevant business processes and policies to ensure compliance in execution, working together with internal and external business partners and functions Creates and fosters awareness and understanding of Import and Export rules and regulations by providing concise updates of changes in relevant laws, regulations and data, and aligns any resulting required process adjustments with the relevant internal and external partners to ensure compliance in execution. Oversees day to day work in relevant import and export processes executed by internal and external partners, provides support and is involved in execution of day to work actively; Workload management Review of accuracy of import and export declarations made by customs agents, actioning and follow-up of any required corrections or document completion Maintenance of internal import / export tracking databases Collection, consolidation and logical storage of all relevant import and export documentation Exchange of required information with customs broker / suppliers to complete execution of imports and exports Manages and facilitates internal and external (customs) audits Acts as center point of contact for customs brokers and suppliers to manage import and export processes and to mitigate any obstacles or bottlenecks. Manages and handles queries and issues as they surface in day to day import and export execution. Maintenance of HS commodity code classification, country of origin, preferential status and other relevant import / export data in MSA tools (eg. SAP) and pro-active updating of relevant business partners with this data, including customs agents, forwarders and (intercompany) suppliers HS commodity code classification of products with help from product management, R+D, suppliers and MSA Global Trade Management Qualifications 5-7 years of experience in Import / Export / Customs operations operating with different Moroccan customs regimes such as Temporary Admission, Inward / Outward processing, standard import and exports

companie: BDP International
intro:
About PSA BDP: 

PSA BDP, a member of the PSA Group, is a leading provider of globally integrated and port-centric supply chain, transportation, and logistics solutions. The company is headquartered in Philadelphia, PA, and employs more than 5,500 people worldwide.

We are a team that celebrates our unique diversity and close-knit community atmosphere. Our core values begin at the very top and span the broad reach of our global community.

We offer dynamic careers for those individuals looking to be a part of something bigger and provide unequivocal opportunities for growth within the organization.

PSA BDP serves over 5,000 customers, including some of the world's leading multinational companies within the chemical, retail & consumer, life sciences & pharmaceuticals, and electric vehicle & industrial verticals. 

Scope :

The Pricing Intern will work under the guidance of the Country Ocean Product Manager to support day-to-day pricing requests. Their primary focus will be on data handling and supporting pricing decisions across products and customers.

Responsibilities :

vCalculation & production  of transport quotations in concert with product manager
vContact carriers and agents, send and follow the rate requests
vSafeguard core carrier utilization in concert with the product
vSupport the compilation of pricing data for tenders and help ensure all required inputs arecomplete and accurate
vAssist in tracking carrier allocation in line with procurement guidelines.


Qualifications/Experience

•Must have a High School diploma or equivalent; currently enrolled in or recently completed a degree in Business, Supply Chain, Logistics, or a related field.
•No prior experience required, but any exposure to the freight forwarding or carrier industry (via coursework, internships, or projects) is a plus.
•Basic working knowledge of Microsoft Excel (e.g., data entry, formulas, formatting).
•Willingness to learn and develop strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
•Good communication and interpersonal skills, with a collaborative mindset.
•Ability to adapt quickly to new tools, processes, and team dynamics.
•Professional, proactive, and eager to contribute in a team environment.
•Basic understanding of professional telephone and email etiquette.
•Good command of English.

companie: Nielsen Consumer LLC
intro:
Job Description
About this job

This role combines data analysis and client consultation from the start, with plenty of room for growth. You find the stories behind scatter plots and help clients answer their business issues. Your insights will influence decisions for some of today’s leading global companies.

Responsibilities

Managing a portfolio of NielsenIQ retail FMCG partners in Maghreb countries;
Become an expert and own the ways of working on the Discover platform to be able to direct clients as needed;
Analyze and interpret retail audit data with actionable presentations on different FMCG categories to answer clients' business issues;
Ensure a daily interface with clients for data delivery, analysis, and answer their different requests;
Ensure day-to-day relationship management with internal teams for the completion of projects (panel & ad hoc);
Communicate clearly, professionally, and in a timely manner with both internal and external stakeholders;
Maintain client satisfaction with every encounter. Through understanding client queries, managing internal resources, setting client expectations & committing to timelines;
Use internal tools and data sources.
A little about you

Curiosity drives your interest in what moves the market. You find potential in percentages. Managing time and deadlines comes naturally to you. You’re known for your impeccable organization. Connecting with clients matters to you, and that motivates you to sift through data from a new angle. You can identify the narratives behind numbers, and you’re always looking for what’s next.

Qualifications

At least a bachelor's degree, preferably in business, economics, mathematics, statistics, or equivalent
1-2 years of work experience preferably within consumer or trade marketing, analytics and insights or market research
Knowledge of the Consumer-Packaged Goods (CPG) industry
Excellent analytical skills
Good communication skills both written and verbal
Good interpersonal skills
Adaptable to changes in priority or tasks
Has interest and knowledge on consumer marketing, statistics, research techniques, and experimental designs
Proficient in Microsoft Excel & PowerPoint, and learning new software
An ability to work independently and in a team
Fluent in spoken and written English and Business French
Comfortable working in a digital-enabled environment
#LI-Hybrid


Additional Information
Our Benefits

Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)
About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

description:
Job Description:


Job Title: Account Executive
Location: Morocco, Casablanca
Job Type: Full-time
About Dentsu International:
Dentsu is one of the largest marketing and advertising groups, providing a full suite of creative, data, technology and media services to its global clients in 145 countries.
We empower the world’s leading brands to create better creative and customer experiences with a focus on digital and creative transformation. We are champions for innovative marketing success across a diverse portfolio of fortune 100 companies, leading organisations and clients across key iconic brands advertising globally to maximise the value of our customer portfolios to drive hyper-personalised marketing and creative strategies.
Our combined strengths in creative excellence, customer digital transformation, media and enterprise marketing technology drives our competitive advantage. This includes a wide range of services to clients across media, advertising creative, PR, television format production, sports stadium advertising, talent and influencer engagement, app and website development, game development, programmatic advertising, IT consultancy, and data products, analytics and insight.
About the Client – Beiersdorf Morocco:
Beiersdorf AG is a global skincare leader, home to iconic brands such as NIVEA, Eucerin, La Prairie, Labello, Hansaplast, and Tesa. With 22,000+ employees in over 160 countries, they are focused on innovation, skin science, and helping people feel good in their skin.
The Role:
We’re looking for an experienced Account Executive to lead and manage the delivery of permanent and temporary POS and commercial print campaigns across Beiersdorf brands in Egypt. This is a fast-paced, client-facing role requiring strong project management, attention to detail, and commercial acumen.
Key Responsibilities:


End-to-end campaign and project management Client relationship management and exceptional service delivery On-site client visits and store checks as needed Collaboration with internal buying, creative, and production teams Supplier sourcing, negotiation, and procurement Ensuring projects are delivered on time, on budget, and to brief
What You’ll Bring:


Experience managing POS and print campaigns (essential) Background in FMCG, CPG, or consumer healthcare Strong project management and organisational skills Confident communicator and relationship builder Commercial mindset with strong Excel/data analysis skills Knowledge of creative/artwork and production processes Flexible, proactive and solutions-focused
What’s in it for you:


Annual bonus (based on performance & company profitability) Private health insurance for self and family. 3 wellness days Ongoing training via Dentsu University Internal mobility and MENA regional exposure A diverse, multicultural, and supportive team environment
Diversity and Inclusion:
Dentsu is committed to equity, inclusion and diversity. We believe bringing your whole self to work enables growth, innovation and stronger business outcomes. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds and experiences to apply.
Apply online now! If you meet the criteria, one of our recruiters will be in touch. If not this time, we’ll keep your profile in our talent pool for future opportunities.

titre: Chef de projet Analyste ALM en Freelance Ref. 006014
companie: Novancy Consulting
intro:
Pour le compte de notre client, nous recherchons un Chef de projet Analyste ALM en Freelance pour la mise en place de la solution cible ALM. 

Durée de mission: 3 mois renouvelables (La durée prévisionnelle du projet est de 12 mois)
lieux: Casablanca Maroc
Démarrage: ASAP
Missions

Mise en place de la solution cible ALM dans le cadre du projet d’autonomisation
La principale mission est le renforcement du dispositif métier pour assurer l’aboutissement dudit projet, à travers les éléments suivants :
L’analyse de l’existant
Expression et définition du besoin et des processus cibles
Définition des règles métiers de calcul des métriques ALM
Définition des règles de gestion fonctionnelles
Validation du cahier des charges fonctionnel
Déroulement de la recette bancaire et homologation des Métriques et des reporting règlementaires.
Assistance post-démarrage en vue de la stabilisation du dispositif
Assurer une coordination avec les équipes ALM, IT et l’éditeur de l’outil.
Assurer la mise en œuvre et l’amélioration des calculs des métriques ALM (risque de taux, liquidité et change)
Participer à l’amélioration des processus de chargement des données et à la réduction du risque opérationnel (refonte d’une base Access et de certains traitements hors outils)
Rédiger la documentation fonctionnelle et technique des évolutions mises en place
Accompagnement des équipes ALM dans la conduite du changement, formation sur le nouveau dispositif tant sur le plan fonctionnel que technique, passation et démocratisation des outils mis en place
La participation active dans le projet d’autonomisation pour mettre en place une solution ALM permettant :
De maintenir à minima le standing des livrables ALM actuels, palier aux limites soulevées sur l’outil existant sous son actuelle configuration et de répondre et suivre les évolutions réglementaires dictées par Bank Al-Maghrib.
De répondre aux exigences réglementaires locales, aux exigences du pilotage ALM interne, en respectant les délais de livraison du projet.
Le calcul des indicateurs ALM, afin d’apprécier les expositions aux risques de liquidité, de taux et de change :
Calcul des gaps de liquidité en statique et en dynamique
Calcul des gaps de taux en statique
Calcul de la NPV et la sensibilité de la NPV aux chocs de taux
Calcul de la MNI budgétée (vision full dynamique) et de la sensibilité de la MNI au choc de taux
Calcul de la MNI bilan constant (vision semi-dynamique) et de la sensibilité de la MNI au choc de taux
Calcul des TCI stock, nécessaires à l’analyse de la rentabilité, à la maille :
Contrat : pour les produits contractuels
Agrégat : pour les produits non amortissables
De disposer de rapports de calcul ALM en stand-alone et en consolidé, maison-mère et filiale
De fournir un amortissement par nature de produit, par scénario sur la base d’une granularité contractuelle des données du bilan et hors bilan
De permettre un rapprochement de la donnée de gestion avec la donnée comptable dans un premier temps, puis générer les positions de réconciliation
D’assurer un processus d’alimentation automatique de la donnée de gestion & comptable dans l’outil ALM
De fournir des rapports d’analyse intra-situations (comparaison des situations inter-arrêtés, vue historique des agrégats, etc…)
de veiller à la Data Quality ALM :
Exhaustivité et fiabilité des données de gestion
Mise en place et fiabilisation des référentiels ALM (Market Data, statique Data,)
Suivi des ajustements Compta/Gestion et de la RCG
Mise en place de rapports et de contrôles permettant de s’assurer de la fiabilité des données de gestion avant et après intégration dans l’outil ALM
La mise en place de procédures ALM :
Mise en place des modes opératoires détaillés encadrant l’ensemble des processus de production et de contrôle des métriques ALM ;
Profil Recherché:

Un Chef de projet expert (plus de 10 ans d’expérience) ayant une forte expérience sur les projets ALM, de calcul de la MNI, et de pilotage de la liquidité du taux et de la position de change.
La maitrise des méthodologies projets est indispensable.
Diplômé d’un bac+5 d’une école de commerce ou d’ingénierie (option Finance), avec une expérience de 10 ans minimum au sein d’un client grand compte dans les secteurs de la Banque, Finance et / ou Assurance
Expérience confirmée en ALM avec une bonne maîtrise des modèles de calcul des risques structurels
Une connaissance de l’outil fusionrisk tant sur le plan fonctionnel que technique.
Une expérience en Gestion de projet agile ou cycle en V
Rigueur et sens de l’organisation
Anglais obligatoire
Sens du risque
Organisation et planification
Rigueur et fiabilité
Autonomie et capacité de proposition et d’anticipation.
Capacités relationnelles et aisance dans les échanges avec les diverses équipes. 
Maîtrise des outils d'automatisation des traitements de données et de publications des reporting (fonction d’Excel complexes, VBA, Python ou R, Access)
Expérience avérée dans la modélisation d’écoulement ALM
Maitrise de la valorisation des instruments financiers
Bonne connaissance des produits bancaires et financiers (dérivés, …),
Connaissance de l’environnement réglementaire et du contexte de marché
Autonomie, prise d'initiative et aptitude à gérer les priorités et respecter les délais
Bonnes qualités relationnelles, goût du travail en équipe, et qualité de dialogue
Attachement à la qualité du travail
Capacité d'analyse et de synthèse.

titre: Développeur Flux de données Informatica Senior (H/F)
companie: SQLI
intro:
Description de l'entreprise
Notre mission depuis 30 ans ? Être présent au bon moment !

Notre expertise ? Accompagner nos clients à capter l’attention de l’utilisateur et transformer cette interaction furtive en une interaction mémorable. C’est dans cette optique que nous accompagnons les entreprises dans la mise en œuvre, et le pilotage de dispositifs digitaux pour une expérience utilisateur réinventée.

La juste interaction, c’est quoi ? C’est capter notre attention au bon moment, au bon endroit et la convertir en envie et en confiance. Un équilibre subtil entre le trop et le trop peu. Entre le trop tôt et le trop tard.

Devenez SQLien et faites partie de cette grande aventure au sein d’une société à taille humaine, mais avec de grandes ambitions. Nous sommes plus de 2200 talents sur plus de 13 pays et 3 continents.

Notre culture ?
Oser et créer.
description:
Description du poste
En tant que Développeur Flux Informatica, vous serez en charge de la conception, du développement, de l’intégration et du maintien des flux de données au sein de notre infrastructure Informatica. Vous interviendrez à toutes les étapes des projets liés à l’intégration de données, de l’analyse des besoins jusqu'à la mise en production.

Vos missions incluent :

Développement et maintenance des flux de données : Créer, optimiser et maintenir les flux de données (ETL) à l’aide de l’outil Informatica PowerCenter.

Analyse des besoins métiers : Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de flux de données et proposer des solutions adaptées.

Conception et architecture des flux : Rédiger les spécifications techniques et proposer des solutions efficaces et évolutives pour les flux de données.

Suivi des performances : Analyser les performances des flux de données et effectuer des optimisations pour garantir leur efficacité et leur fiabilité.

Tests et validation : Réaliser des tests unitaires et fonctionnels pour assurer la qualité des développements avant leur mise en production.

Support et maintenance : Fournir un support technique pour la résolution des incidents en production et assurer la maintenance corrective et évolutive des flux.

Documentation : Rédiger et maintenir à jour la documentation technique liée aux flux de données, aux processus d'intégration et aux interfaces.


Qualifications
Compétences requises :

Compétences techniques :

Maîtrise d’Informatica PowerCenter et/ou d’Informatica Cloud.

Bonne connaissance des bases de données SQL (Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL, etc.).

Connaissance en gestion de processus d'intégration de données et d’ETL.

Expérience dans l’optimisation des performances des flux de données.

Connaissance des outils de gestion de version (Git, SVN).

Bonne compréhension des concepts de gestion des erreurs et des logs dans les flux de données.

Compétence en scripting (Shell, Python, etc.) est un plus.

Compétences fonctionnelles :

Bonnes capacités d’analyse et de compréhension des besoins métiers.

Autonomie dans la gestion des projets et des priorités.

Bonne communication écrite et orale, capacité à travailler en équipe.

Sens de la rigueur et de la qualité, souci du détail.

Profil recherché :

Diplôme en informatique ou équivalent (Bac +3/5).

Minimum de [X] années d’expérience dans le développement de flux de données avec Informatica.

Une expérience préalable dans un environnement similaire (gestion de données massives, Data Warehouse, Big Data, etc.) est un plus.

Capacité à travailler dans un environnement agile et à gérer plusieurs projets en parallèle.

Un bon niveau d’anglais est un atout.


Informations complémentaires
Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe ?

Un environnement dynamique et innovant, au sein d’une équipe passionnée par les technologies de données.
La possibilité de travailler sur des projets d’envergure, à la pointe des technologies cloud et Big Data.
Des opportunités d’évolution et de formation continue pour développer vos compétences.
Un cadre de travail flexible et des avantages attractifs.

titre: HR - Senior Associate career process optimization and insights - Casablanca
companie: Infomineo
intro:
About us

Infomineo is a fast-growing business insights provider, bringing Brainshoring to global clients across a range of services: Business research, Content Services, Graphic Design, and Data Analytics. Our clients include leading Consultancies, Fortune 500 companies, Governments, and NGOs. Infomineo counts 350+ employees spread across 5 offices covering EMEA and the Americas (Casablanca, Cairo, Dubai, Barcelona and Mexico City). 

About this Role

In this role, the Senior Associate Career Process Optimization & Insights will be the go-to person for data analytics, process improvement, and project coordination—ensuring that high-value initiatives run smoothly. While you’ll collaborate on strategic topics, the final decisions and ownership remain at the senior leadership level. You will support the Director and senior team members in designing and executing programs related to career frameworks, succession planning, performance management, employee engagement, and internal mobility.

What will you do?

Process Improvement & Innovation

Contribute ideas for streamlining and digitizing existing career management processes (e.g., automating career committee, surveys, reducing manual data entry, etc.).
Partner with internal IT/Teach teams or external vendors to test and implement new performance management and HR tech features or integrations, under the guidance of senior team members.
Research and recommend best practices or emerging tools in talent management, ensuring Infomineo stays at the forefront of industry developments.
Analytics & Reporting

Gather, analyze, and interpret data on performance, succession, internal mobility, and engagement metrics.
Create user-friendly dashboards and reports (Excel, Power BI, etc.) for senior leadership review.
Collaborate with the Director to identify trends, potential gaps, or optimization opportunities in talent pipelines.
Proactively flag potential risks or resource constraints, offering recommendations to keep initiatives on track.
Project Coordination & Support

Develop project timelines, coordinate stakeholder meetings, and track milestones to ensure timely completion of deliverables.
Assist in planning and executing performance review cycles, career internal mobility initiatives, and high-potential programs.
Act as a central point of communication, disseminating project updates to relevant departments.
Employee Engagement & Communication

Liaise with department heads, and other teams to facilitate program rollouts (e.g., refresher sessions, sharing guidelines).
Prepare clear, concise communication materials and campaigns (e.g., email announcements, internal communication, FAQs sessions) to support program adoption and understanding. (Eg, career development initiatives, high potential programs, and internal mobility opportunities).
Collect feedback through surveys or focus groups from managers and employees, escalating any significant issues or recommendations to the Director.
Performance Management & Internal Mobility

Work closely with managers/PDCs and Heads to coordinate performance review cycles, calibrations, and career discussions.
Facilitate career internal mobility processes—posting roles internally, gathering applications, and supporting the selection and placement steps—while keeping accurate records.
Who you are?

Bachelor’s degree in HR, Business Administration, or a related discipline.
3–5 years of relevant project coordination, analytics or HR preferably in talent management, career development, or organizational development contexts.
Proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets (pivot tables, dashboards, data analysis).
Exposure to HRIS systems (e.g., Odoo) or talent management platforms
Familiarity with project management tools (e.g., Trello, Asana) is a plus.
Strong verbal and written English. French or Arabic proficiency is advantageous (depending on location/team mix).
Experience tailoring communication to multiple audiences (e.g., senior leaders, junior employees).
Key competencies:

Analytical & Data-Driven: Skilled at transforming data into actionable insights.
Project Management: Highly organized, able to prioritize multiple initiatives, and meet deadlines.
Process Improvement Mindset: Open to exploring new technologies; suggests digital or operational enhancements.
Collaboration & Communication: Comfortable working with stakeholders at all levels; excels at concise messaging and presentations.
Adaptability & Continuous Learning: Thrives in a dynamic environment; seeks feedback to grow professionally.
What we offer

A competitive salary
A great working environment & fast-track career trajectory
A healthy work-life balance
Health insurance Benefits
What is it like to work at Infomineo?

If you've spoken with someone who works at Infomineo, you've probably heard that our people are our most valuable asset. Our diversity, both in terms of professional experience and culture, is the company’s greatest strength.

As a Senior Associate in Career Process Optimization & Insights, you’ll be part of a collaborative, international HR team focused on innovation and impact. You'll contribute to initiatives around career development, performance management, and employee engagement, while learning best practices in process optimization and HR analytics. Your ideas will help streamline processes and shape meaningful talent programs, playing a key role in enhancing the employee experience and supporting Infomineo’s growth.

Equal opportunity employer

Infomineo is an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any sort of discrimination (based on color, race, sex, sexual orientation, religion, national origin or any other attributes) in all aspects of employment (recruiting, hiring, wages and salary, promotions, benefits, trainings and job termination).

If you believe you match our requirements and values, we would be happy to hear from you. Visit our website to know more about us, our services and company culture.

companie: Novancy Consulting
intro:
Description: 

The AI Solution Architect designs and builds AI-driven solutions, ensuring that they meet both business and technical requirements. They define the overall architecture for AI systems, ensure scalability and integration with existing infrastructure, and provide guidance on the selection of technologies and tools. They work closely with the AI Implementation Expert and Data Engineers to ensure solutions are aligned with best practices and business goals.

Mission: 3 months (renewable for the duration of the project).
Location: Rabat/Casablanca, Morocco.
Start Date: ASAP.
Language: Fluent English required (CVs must be submitted in English).
Work Mode: Hybrid (mix of on-site and remote work).
Key Responsibilities:

Design and architect AI solutions tailored to specific business needs and technical environments.
Lead the selection of appropriate AI tools, platforms, and technologies.
Develop high-level solution designs and technical architectures for AI systems.
Ensure integration of AI solutions with existing data systems and business processes.
Guide the implementation of AI models, ensuring they are scalable, maintainable, and secure.
Collaborate with Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and delivery team for solution deployment.
competences:
Skills Needed:

Experience with data pipelines, storage, and integration tools (e.g., Kafka, Hadoop, Spark).
Ability to balance business needs with technical feasibility and performance.
System Design & Architecture: Ability to design AI systems that are scalable, secure, and efficient, taking into account data privacy and security. (Kubernetes, Docker, OpenShift)
Advanced Knowledge of AI/ML Algorithms: Expertise in machine learning, deep learning, NLP, and other AI technologies and frameworks.
Data Engineering: Ability to design data pipelines and manage large datasets effectively. (Apache Kafka, RabbitMQ)
Cloud & Infrastructure: Expertise in cloud-based infrastructures (AWS, Azure, GCP, Oracle) and AI-specific solutions.
Integration: Ability to integrate AI models into existing business systems, ensuring seamless operation.
DevOps & Automation: Experience with deployment tools, automation, and continuous integration. (Jenkins, GitLab CI, CircleCI, Travis CI,…)
Problem-Solving: Ability to solve complex technical and business problems through innovative AI solutions. (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Scikit-learn, XGBoost, Hugging Face Transformers, SpaCy, NLTK, OpenAI Gym, Ray RLlib)
Communication Skills: Communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. And Strong communication and leadership skills to guide teams through solution design and execution.
--

intro:
SWATX is on the lookout for a DS Senior Campaign Manager who will bring a data-centric approach to our marketing initiatives. This strategic role is critical for driving impactful campaigns that leverage advanced data science methodologies. You will work closely with data teams to design and execute marketing strategies that not only meet business objectives but also foster customer engagement through data-informed decisions.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead the formulation and execution of data-driven marketing campaign strategies across various channels, ensuring alignment with customer insights and business goals.
Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to implement advanced analytical models that enhance targeted marketing efforts and optimize customer interactions.
Manage all aspects of the campaign lifecycle, from strategic planning and creative development to execution, analysis, and reporting.
Utilize data analytics tools to monitor campaign performance metrics, providing actionable recommendations for improvement and refinement of tactics.
Foster collaboration between marketing, sales, and product teams to ensure cohesive and effective campaign execution.
Stay informed about the latest trends in data science and marketing analytics to ensure SWATX remains at the forefront of data-driven decision-making.
Mentor junior team members, promoting a culture of data literacy and continuous learning within the marketing team.

intro:
Welcome to the Societe Generale Careers website.


# Analyste Financier Junior - Finance de marché
Banque de financement et d'investissement
---
CDI
Casablanca, Région de Casablanca-Settat, Maroc
Télétravail possible
---
Référence 24000KSR
Date de début Immediately
Date de publication 10/04/2025
Définition les règles de gestion de la FPV :
•    Formaliser la description métier du référentiel de structure analytique avec l’aide des Business Data Owner. 
•    Maintenir la documentation de référence et s’assurer de la mise en place des règles de gestion dans les outils. 
•    Communiquer les informations aux utilisateurs et assurer des actions de formations.
Supervision de la qualité du référentiel : 
•    Réaliser / superviser les contrôles qualité sur les données et les règles de gestion du référentiel 
•    Mener des actions pour la sécurisation des données et animations de comités de supervision 
•    Garantir la cohérence entre la description métier et la description applicative des données en menant la campagne de revue d’utilisation de la FPV par les systèmes
Business Data Designer : 
•    Guider les projets et demandes d’évolution dans le respect des normes et standards s’appliquant au référentiel FPV 
•    En charge de la conduite du changement sur les évolutions du référentiel (normes et standards), challenge des demandes et formalisation de la description des données business (rédaction des expressions de besoin et validation en participant aux tests utilisateurs).
Support opérationnel de l’équipe de gestion des données de la FPV (FPV data Manager) : 
•    Co-supervision de la maintenance et des évolutions de l’outil de gestion de la FPV (Starware) 
•    Collaboration pour la gestion de la qualité des données et des processus de production dans le respect des règles de gestion.
Répondre aux sollicitations des auditeurs, inspecteurs (internes/externes) et autorités réglementaires (BCE/FED…).
En tant que membre de l’équipe Data Owner FPV, vous participerez aux différentes missions très variées du rôle de Data Owner dans un environnement transversal et riche qui vous permettra d’étendre vos connaissances métier et développer vos compétences en gestion de la qualité et gestion projet. Vous : 
•    Participez à la définition de la roadmap annuelle de l’équipe et prenez en charge une partie des tâches. 
•    Participez à l’élaboration, la maintenance et la diffusion des règles de gestion de la FPV 
•    Participez à l’animation de la communauté des différents Business Data Owner de la FPV qui comprend des membres du front office, de RISQ et de DFIN 
•    Participez à l’analyse et la promotion de la qualité des données (réalisation de dashboard, comités de remédiation, études sur les données/process…) 
•    Assurez des actions de formation et de documentation (e-learning, formation interne, à la carte, documents de référence FPV, maintenance du site Jive, Chatbot,  ..) 
•    Participez ou menez des projets utilisant la FPV ou d’évolution de la FPV 
•    Participez ou menez des actions de contrôle et sécurisation des données de la FPV et de leur utilisation 
•    Contribuez aux réponses aux sollicitations et aux recommandations des auditeurs et inspecteurs 
•    Participez ou menez des études et missions sur la FPV mandatées par les différents partenaires (DFIN, OPER, RISK et autres).
•    Vous êtes titulaire d’un diplôme Bac+4/5, de type école de commerce, d’ingénieur ou université avec une spécialisation en Finance de Marché et une expérience préalable en banque est souhaitable.
•    Votre niveau d’anglais est courant et vous avez une très bonne connaissance d’Excel. 
•    Votre rigueur, esprit d’analyse et de synthèse permettront de mener à bien les missions confiées.
Créée en 2014, SG ATS est une filiale du Groupe Société Générale qui fournit des solutions agiles et efficaces aux salles des marchés SG en Europe (principalement à Paris et Londres) afin de les aider à se développer et à répondre aux exigences de plus en plus fortes imposées par les différentes législations bancaires internationales. 
Forte de son succès, SG ATS fournit aujourd'hui des prestations à forte valeur ajoutée à différentes lignes de métiers du Groupe (en Europe principalement mais également aux Etats-Unis et en Asie) sur des activités de marchés, mais également à plusieurs directions du Groupe Société Générale.
Sacrée « Meilleur Employeur 2023 – Maroc » SG ATS est une structure jeune, dynamique qui positionne le capital humain au centre de son développement. SG ATS souhaite donc s’entourer de talents qui participeront activement à la réussite de l’entreprise tout en évoluant dans un environnement international propice au développement de compétences à forte valeur ajoutée. Vous serez basé à Casablanca au sein de la filiale SG Africa Technologies & Services (SGT ATS). 
Au sein de la filiale SG Africa Technologies & Services (SG ATS), vous rejoindrez la Direction Financière (DFIN), opérant pour les activités de Marchés (MARK) sur les normes du référentiel (NOR) : DFIN/MAR/ NOR.
L’équipe Data Owner de la FPV est le partenaire privilégié des experts métiers (Business Data Owner), de l’équipe de gestion des données et du workflow de validation de la structure analytique (SA), et de l’équipe informatique en charge de la SA.
Le secteur bancaire est en perpétuelle mutation, vous évoluerez donc au cœur d’une activité en pleine évolution dans son organisation, ses modes de fonctionnement et dans ses actions de communications
« Les informations recueillies sur ce site font l’objet d’un traitement destiné à répondre aux besoins de recrutement de la société SG ATS. Ces données sont traitées par les services internes de la société. Conformément à la loi n° 09-08 promulguée par le Dahir 1-09-15 du 18 février 2009, relative à la protection des personnes physiques à l’égard du traitement des données à caractère personnel, vous bénéficiez d’un droit d’accès et de rectification aux informations qui vous concernent, que vous pouvez exercer en vous adressant à donnees-personnelles.sgats@sgcib.com .Vous pouvez également, pour des motifs légitimes, vous opposer à ce que les données qui vous concernent fassent l’objet d’un traitement. Ces données peuvent faire l’objet d’un transfert à l’étranger. Ces traitements ont été notifiés et autorisés par la CNDP sous les numéros A-RH-354/2016 et T-RH-129/2016.

companie: Orange Group
intro:
Finance Partner on cost process


ref :582391 | 16 Jan 2025
apply before : 16 Apr 2025
Morocco - Sala Al Jadida - Morocco
about the role


Job Summary:
The Financial Analyst Partner will play a crucial role in performing centralized analyses, ensuring data quality, and supporting the finance community. This position involves preparing KPI reports, monitoring month-end activities, and guiding the finance team in budget and forecast preparation.
Key Responsibilities:


- Centralized Analysis and Reporting:
Perform monthly analyses and share outcomes with the finance community. Conduct data quality checks and oversee transactions related to data amendments. Prepare KPI reports based on monthly data checks and analyze discrepancies between actual and estimated start and end dates. Ensure the production of reports, such as general expenses & MEJ, while maintaining quality and timeliness.- Controlling Support:
Cooperate and support the controlling team. Monitor proper month-end activities, including inventory recognition and deferrals. Supervise the accuracy of accounting inputs. Act as the point of contact for issues with the transactional team (Accenture). Centralize controlling activities related to Purchase Orders (PO), including closing POs and capturing PO data. Support controllers in budget and forecast preparation.- Guidance and Support for the Finance Community:
Collect and share knowledge within the finance community. Animate workshops and gather information on the automation of the PO process. Master existing reports and educate/support users on tools such as Power BI and Alteryx. Assist in report creation and testing.- Support Finance Transformation & Innovation:
Participate in finance transformation and innovation projects and initiatives. Contribute to the definition of specifications for new reports. Collaborate with the Data & Reporting team to ensure continuity of service. Conduct ad-hoc analyses on specific issues with a transversal overview. Enforce processes defined with stakeholders and improve the timeliness, relevance, and accuracy of reporting.
about you


Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field. Proven experience in financial analysis, reporting, and controlling. Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Power BI, Alteryx). Strong analytical skills and attention to detail. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Additional Considerations:


Highlight opportunities for professional development and growth within the organization. Emphasize the importance of innovation and continuous improvement in the finance function. Consider including specific metrics or goals for the role to provide clarity on performance expectations.
department


Finance

Our extensive experience and knowledge in global communication solutions, together with our understanding of multinational business and local support in 166 countries and territories, ensure that our customers receive a consistent, global solution wherever they do business
Only your skills matter


Regardless of your age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, neuroatypia, disability or appearance, we encourage diversity within our teams because it is a strength for the collective and a vector of innovation. Orange Group is a disabled-friendly company: don't hesitate to tell us about your specific needs.

intro:
Au sein du Grouper, Digital Solutions est le Centre De Services nearshore du groupe Petit Forestier.


Crée en 2017, PFDS accompagne le groupe dans sa transformation digitale en offrant un catalogue de services complet (Support applicatif et infrastructure multi-niveaux, Développement, administration et maintenance des systèmes d'informations groupe, Test et qualité logicielle, BI et Data Quality, Cyber sécurité, Business Process Outsourcing)

Quelles seront vos missions à ce poste ?



Conception, rédaction et maintenance des cahiers de tests en coordination avec les Chefs de projets et Product Owners.

Participer à l’élaboration de la stratégie qualité de l’équipe.

Contribuer à la traduction des besoins métiers en fonctionnalités et en user stories.

Participation active dans l'industrialisation des tests

Préparation des jeux de données

Exécuter les tests avec comme objectif de détecter un maximum d’anomalies

Gérer de bout en bout les anomalies associées aux cas de tests (suivi, correction, planning...)

Mener de bout en bout les compagnes de non-régression (Définition du périmètre, exécution des TNR, suivi des anomalies...)

Rédiger les comptes rendus d’activités et les rapports de tests


Qualités requises :


Maitrise d’outils de gestion de tests et suivi d’anomalies de type HP ALM, JIRA, XRAY

Être flexible, organisé et méthodique

Capacité de travailler en autonomie et en équipe

Compréhension des enjeux de la stratégie de test

Bonne communication orale et écrite en Français. L’anglais est un plus

Connaissance et pratique de la méthodologie Agile

Soucis du détail et rigueur permettant d’assurer la qualité des applications testées


Quel est le profil recherché pour ce poste ?

Formation de niveau Bac+5 en informatique

Minimum 2 ans d’expérience dans le test logiciel idéalement sur des projets CRM (ex: Salesforce) , ERP (ex: SAP), Cloud

La certification ISTQB Foundation est un plus

Join our dynamic Customer Service team at Arrow! Our team is built on a foundation of collaboration, trust, friendliness, and positivity. If you speak English and enjoy working with others, this might be the perfect opportunity for you!
As part of our company´s growth, 
ARROW Morocco is strengthening its teams and is looking for a Customer Service Associate.


We have currently a team in Casablanca where the atmosphere is friendly, sociable and positive. If you speak English and you like to work with other people - this might be something for you!
The Customer Service Associate is responsible for supporting the Sales team to enhance the customer relationship through proactive ownership of the entire customer backlog starting with a clean order load. From order load, the Customer Service Associate takes care of backlog management actions through, to invoice and delivery of parts to nominated customers. Customer Service Associate also manages customer reserved inventory to meet all related goals and objectives for both Arrow and the Customer.
Order to Invoice process. Communication with Customers, Suppliers and delivering after-sales service for Business Customers (telephone, mail). Order Management. Managing and responding to all requested customer backlog changes. Close cooperation with other departments like Sales, Assets and Logistics.
Driving
On-Time-Delivery performance in line with customer and company goals.


Generating customer satisfaction.
Close
teamwork with Inside Sales and Product Management.


Managing customer reserved inventory.
Driving efficiency.
Advance level of English, plus one of the following languages in advance level, Spanish, Italian or French.
At least 1-2 years of Customer Service, Order Management or Sales experience.


Good knowledge of MS Office, Excel required.
Accountability. Communication and coordination skills. Customer-oriented attitude.
Team player.

friendly work atmosphere.

companie: TE Connectivity
intro:
# STRATEGIC SOURCING ANALYST (Project Buyer)
At TE, you will unleash your potential working with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to create a safer, sustainable and more connected world.
##
Job Overview


TE Connectivity's Strategic Sourcing Teams develop and implement multi-year strategies for assigned commodities, suppliers and parts/services to achieve established goals in supplier quality, delivery, price and service. They align strategy and execution with cross-functional partners such as engineering, manufacturing, product management and functional owners. They execute the competitive bid, negotiation, contracting processes and/or technical continuous improvement for assigned commodities or services; collaborate across Business Units and cross-regions for optimal TE leverage. Our teams demonstrate a high level of expertise in procurement competencies (business/supply chain acumen, negotiation, sourcing strategy development and execution, global savvy, and project and product lifecycle management) and ensure results are delivered compliant with TE policies and procedures.
##
Your main tasks


•    Participate & implement regional procurement strategies that are innovative, cost-effective, and incorporate the growing complexities and challenges within the industry
•    Ensure that purchasing policy processes are in place to meet business objectives and operational needs, regarding price, quality and delivery targets, to optimize performance and productivity
•    Conduct market research and analysis to identify new suppliers, materials, and cost-saving opportunities.
•    Establish, Review and Manage contracts with suppliers and ensure favorable pricing and delivery terms while maintaining quality standards.
•    To manage and negotiate annual increases proposed by suppliers, ensuring that the proposed increase is market related.
•    Use appropriate resources (including Supplier Development) to ensure supplier partnerships and delivery of sourced products
•    Manage relationships with suppliers. Select and develop new suppliers
•    Build long-term relationships with vendors in the industry
•    Provide management reports, key performance data and monitor cost
•    Ensure parts are sourced in full and aligned to production schedules and customer requirements
•    Lead cross-functional project for localization and outsourcing
•    Lead and track annual cost saving project
•    Ensuring full TE compliance respect
##
Your ideal background


- Master’s degree in business, Supply Chain, Engineering, or related field required\
\


Professional Experience
- 3-5 years of experience in the automotive industry, in direct procurement or related field
- Project management capabilities
- Value stream mapping
Special Qualifications, Knowledge & Skills
- Understanding of the supply chain and value chain in the automotive industry
- Contract Negotiation\
\

: Proven track record in negotiating contracts for direct goods and services in the automotive industry. Ability to negotiate pricing, terms, and quality to achieve optimal outcomes.
- Supplier Management\
\

: Experience in managing supplier relationships in the automotive industry. Ability to develop and maintain positive relationships with suppliers, evaluate supplier performance, and address non-performance issues.
- Fluent in English and French, both written and spoken
- Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Strategic KPIs
- \
\

Cost Savings\
\

: Measures the amount of money saved by implementing procurement strategies and initiatives that result in cost reductions.
- \
\

Procurement Cycle Time\
\

: Measures the time it takes to complete the procurement process, from identifying the need to awarding the contract. Ensures that the procurement process is efficient and effective.
- \
\

Environmental Sustainability\
\

: Measures the organization's impact on the environment through its procurement activities. Ensures that the organization promotes sustainable practices in its procurement processes.
- Lead the process of procurement and documentation
Operational KPIs
- \
\

Requisition to PO Conversion Rate\
\

: Measures the percentage of requisitions that are successfully converted to purchase orders. Ensures that the procurement process is effective in meeting the needs of the organization.
- Core material productivity (CMP)
- Delivery STR
- Quality SATI
- Quality SCCC

description:
Job Description:


ABOUT THE ROLE:


 
Arrow ECS is a specialist IT distributor providing enterprise-class solutions and services focused on data storage, network security, enterprise software, virtualization and access infrastructure.
Working with our channel partners, we optimize the efficiency with which organizations can store, manage, protect and deploy their data, equipping them with secure access to business-critical information at any time, from any location, on any device.
Through close alliances with the world’s leading vendors, we deliver innovative solutions, complemented by an impressive portfolio of expert professional services and IT training. We support our channel partners from initial consultation, planning and design, engineering build through to implementation and post-sales care.
 
WHAT YOU WILL DO:


Processing/progressing orders and working closely with the Quote & configuration and Renewals team to check pricing and discounts, etc Purchase order placement Update Customer and Customer Service on PO progress, shipment dates, delivery dates, POD’s Claim procedures Warranty Registrations Reconciliation of invoices Support for all aspects of stock management Claim reconciliation and escalation of anomalies/errors through to resolution. Credit note reconciliation and escalation of anomalies/errors through to resolution. Support for all aspects of stock management
 
WHAT WE OFFER:


Excellent training opportunities Permanent job contract Private medical healthcare Fantastic working culture where you can make an impact Nice office facility in an easy-to-reach location Broad selection of teas, coffee and fresh fruits Friendly work atmosphere Casual dress policy Due to the nature of this role flexibility will be required in order to meet the needs of the role especially at month and quarter ends. german bank holidays will apply.
 
WHAT WE LOOK FOR:


Previous experience of working in a business service sector (Purchasing Department) will be advantageous, Excellent written german skills, Honest, hardworking, self motivated, reliable and diligent, Fully accountable and take ownership to resolution, Excellent administration skills, Excellent communication skills, with the ability to liaise with both internal and external contacts at all levels, Able to work as part of a team or on their own initiative, Ability to pay close attention to detail, Able to work towards tight deadlines, Good knowledge of Microsoft packages  – Excel, Word, Microsoft Outlook .

companie: MSA
intro: Overview Are you someone who is passionate, motivated, and driven to make a difference? If so, MSA Safety is the perfect fit for your career. At MSA, SAFETY is who we are AND it is what we do. We are a purpose-driven company committed to deploying innovation and technology to deliver on our Mission to help protect people and assets all around the world. We continue to be relentless in our pursuit of solving our customers greatest problems so they can go home safe each and every day. Are you in? Read on for more details about this particular role. About the role We are looking for an Textil & Sewing Engineering Technician to support the industrialization product in Echallalate MSA Plant working with R&D over the MSA plants, and internally with all Opex department to improve plant KPI’s.This role will contribute to strengthening our commitment to our customer and our customer’s loyalty to MSA. If this sounds like an exciting opportunity, we want to hear from you! Responsibilities Operate, maintain, and troubleshoot sewing machines and related textile equipment. Assist engineers in developing and improving textile manufacturing processes. Support pattern making, cutting, and sewing activities for prototypes and small production runs. Inspect finished products for quality and adherence to specifications. Conduct testing of textile materials to assess durability, strength, and functionality. Collaborate with design and production teams to optimize workflow and efficiency. Implement process improvements to reduce waste and increase productivity. Maintain accurate records of production data, maintenance logs, and testing results. Ensure all safety and environmental regulations are followed on the production floor. Provide training and support to production staff on machine use and sewing techniques. Qualifications Diploma in Textile Engineering, Apparel Manufacturing, Industrial Technology. 3+ years of experience in textile manufacturing or sewing operations preferred. (Type: Work Cloth, Public Uniform, Suits…) Proficient in operating industrial sewing machines (lockstitch, overlock, flatbed, etc.). Familiar with textile properties and garment construction techniques. Strong mechanical aptitude and problem-solving skills. Attention to detail and a commitment to product quality. Ability to read and interpret technical drawings and specifications. Ability to use Tools of problem resolution (6sigma, 5why, 8d...) Lean-Manufacturing is a plus Microsoft Office 365

intro:

# Manager Grands Comptes, Casablanca
inwi est un opérateur digital global, couvrant l’ensemble des services des télécommunications au Maroc. Services Voix (fixe et mobile), Internet et Data à très haut débit à destination du grand public et des entreprises.
Après avoir rendu le mobile accessible à tous, inwi se donne pour mission d’accompagner le développement numérique du pays en rendant l’internet très haut débit accessible à tous les marocains. Pour cela, l’opérateur peut capitaliser sur la qualité de ses infrastructures 4G, Fibre Optique, ADSL et l’Internet par satellite pour raccorder rapidement le plus grand nombre.
Ce que vous ferez:


Rattaché(e) à la Direction Commerciale Grand Compte, vous serez en charge de la prospection et l'identification des besoins des clients Grands Comptes. Ainsi, vous devrez:
Recueillir et analyser les informations concernant les grands comptes affectés, en se basant sur les différentes ressources de l’entité; Développer un portefeuille clients et prospect grands comptes; Etudier et présenter des offres correspondantes aux besoins des clients; Coordonner avec les différents départements pour cerner au mieux le besoin du client et lui faire les propositions les plus adaptées à son besoin; Mettre en place de plans d’actions pour le suivi des affaires et pipe en cours; Fidéliser et gérer la relation clients en identifiants mensuellement des points d’amélioration; Réaliser et atteindre les objectifs prédéfinis en vous atteignant la performance commerciale demandée; Remonter à la Direction un forecast de manière hebdomadaire sur le mois en cours et un pipeline annuel mis à jour.
Le profil que nous recherchons:


Vous êtes titulaire d'un Bac +4/5 d'une Ecole de Commerce et justifiez d'une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans le commercial et la gestion de clients Grands Comptes au sein d’entité opérant dans le secteur IT/ intégrateur  et /ou télécom.
## Nos avantages et bénéfices
### Un aménagement du temps de travail individualisé
Chez inwi, vous bénéficiez d’une flexibilité horaire vous permettant d’organiser vos journées de la manière que vous souhaitez.
### Une formation continue adaptée
Chez inwi, vous montez en compétences en termes de hard skills ou soft skills selon vos besoins. L’académie by inwi est là pour ça.
### Une vie de famille valorisée
En tant que parent-salarié inwi, vous profitez de camps de vacances exclusifs destinés aux familles et aux enfants.
### Un avenir épaulé
En tant que collaborateur inwi, vous bénéficiez de produits d’épargne, de produits d’assurance et de prêts immobiliers à des taux extrêmement avantageux.
### Des réductions exclusives négociées
En tant que collaborateur inwi, vous profitez d’une multitude de produits et services à prix préférentiels auprès de nos nombreux partenaires.
### Un environnement de travail dynamique
Chez inwi, vous êtes entouré(e) d’une équipe jeune et passionnée : c’est une réelle aventure professionnelle qui commence !

intro:
Job Purpose
Provides professional administrative support to the Legal Department to ensure smooth run of  day-to-day activities, this includes but is not limited to communication, meetings, contracts, verification of invoices, presentations, etc. all to be carried out in utmost confidentiality and professionalism in line with company’s policies and procedures. 
Ensures timely execution and thorough follow up on all tasks assigned to him/her whilst maintaining a professional and positive representation of the company


Key Result Responsibilities
Provides administrative support on the day-to-day activities within the legal department; manages a variety of administrative and support duties to ensure efficiency and smooth work-flow.  
Reflects a positive image of a professional and congenial approach throughout all his/her communication whether in person, in telephone, or throughout written/electronic correspondence.  
Interacts internally with all company departments, and externally with clients, government authorities, suppliers, vendors, contractors, consultants, tenants, etc. 
Manages the administration of agreements, contracts, briefings, tenancy contracts, etc. ensuring all are drafted, reviewed by legal department and carried out timely and effectively to facilitate the work needs. Assists the Legal Department in a variety of activities such as reviewing contracts, updating and following up on the litigation report, processing invoices, translation, and maintaining the filing system.
Executes and coordinates various tasks of sensitive nature encountered with delicate and confidential information such as company resolutions, agreements, contracts and legal cases. 


Key Result Responsibilities - Continued
Claims Management
Analyze and investigate claims from initiation to resolution.
Oversee settlements, ensure payments, and liaise with relevant stakeholders.
Records Management
Maintain and update physical and digital archives systematically.
Ensure compliance with data protection and confidentiality standards.
Reporting and Analysis
Generate regular status reports and track key claim metrics.
Identify trends and provide recommendations to improve processes.
Administrative Support
Coordinate claims processes across departments and manage documentation.
Assist in updating policies and conducting file audits.
Process Improvement
Identify and implement efficiencies in claims and record-keeping workflows.
Integrate feedback to enhance systems and tools
Maintains an accurate and up-to-date database of all contacts, records, contracts, files, reports, etc. to be retrieved and accessed by authorized personnel whenever and as needed.  
Note – The role defined here is not exhaustive and duties and responsibilities in line with the job function may be added from time to time. 


Qualifications (Academic, training, languages)
Bachelor’s degree in law or equivalent. 
Understanding of basic legal jargon and contractual terms.
Proficient in Microsoft Office and Web Search. 
Very good in English, French & Arabic. Spanish is a plus.
Moroccan Nationality is a must.


Work Experience
Fresh graduates may be considered for this role given they meet/exceed required competencies. 
Excellent communication skills (verbal, written) expressed in high level of accuracy. 
Capable of interacting with top executives, seniors, and subordinates with professionalism. 
Possesses excellent organizing and time management skills in  frequently changing environments. 
Reliable, self-motivated, takes ownership, and displays energy and enthusiasm. 
A team player demonstrates good understanding of how to support teams. 
Proven skills in working with data, records and resources with high efficiency. 
Multi-task oriented with high attention to details. 
Capable of working hard and under pressure. 
Employs technical skills and interpersonal relations to support company’s objectives. 
Demonstrates the ability to contribute and successfully deliver against set KPIs.

companie: Air Arabia
intro:
Job Purpose
To implement the technical procurement processes for the engineering and maintenance activities of Airline fleet and 3rd Party aircrafts including spare parts, components, tools, and equipment. Handles the respective contracts, purchases and payments as per Airline approved standards and in line with regulations and approved specifications.



Key Result Responsibilities
1.    Acts as an interface between Stakeholders and external suppliers to ensure all the technical procurement requirements are been purchased and delivered timely and cost-effectively as per Company’s defined measures and Airbus approved specifications.

2.    Supports in setting up a strategy, operating procedures and Suppliers’ KPIs to ensure best quality and prices are being achieved for all goods and services prior to signing any contract with suppliers. 

3.    Takes part in the negotiations conducted with suppliers on commercial contracts terms and  prices  ensuring all are done as per the Airline adopted procedures and quality standards, Airworthiness regulations and as per Airbus and OEMs’ approved specifications.

4.    Evaluates new vendors and suppliers and carries necessary arrangements and pre-qualification requirements, if needed, in coordination with Quality Assurance and Finance Departments. 

5.    Supports in assessing the performance of existing vendors and suppliers prior to renewing contracts; monitors the vendors’ valuation forms, questionnaires, reports, history, payments, etc.; identifies alternate providers whenever needed.

6.    Establishes the required credit references and account set-up procedures in conjunction with the Finance Department and respective suppliers; coordinates to resolve any pricing or payments issues. 

7.    Partners with the Stores Inspector to control any stores’ discrepancies, mismatch or damages and to resolve the same with suppliers immediately. 

9.    Partners with Stakeholder to ensure continued airworthiness and operational requirements of the fleet are met in a timely manner. 

10.    Establishes effective relationships with cross-functional teams to enhance productivity and quality of services provided by the procurement team; raises issues and suggestions to the corresponding manager accordingly. 

11.    Assists in conducting competitive bid exercises to test pricing and sourcing strategies. Handles the formalities related to tender submissions as per approved and adopted procedures.

12.    Raises and follows up on the quotation requests, purchase orders, exchange orders and loan orders using the inventory control system.  Chases outstanding purchase orders for on-time delivery and updates the details regularly to avoid generating AOG orders.

13.    Ensures all entries have confirmed prices and agreed deliveries to the production schedule.

14.    Coordinates with AOG desk and logistics team for all requirements whenever it is necessary.

15.    Maintains records and an up-to-date database of all details related to suppliers, vendors, customers, prices, transactions, payments, etc.

16.    Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications and establishing personal networks
 


Qualifications (Academic, training, languages)
Bachelor degree in Engineering/Management or equivalent from a recognized university; a degree in Aircraft Engineering/Aeronautical/Electro-Mechanical or equivalent is highly preferred.
Alternately, a higher diploma or certificate in the related field from a recognized university or engineering college combined with the needed experience and exposure.
Engineering Inventory Software certificate is a plus.
Project Management certificate, or alternately the proven corresponding working experience.
Proficient in Microsoft Office skills.
Cost Control, Compliance, Budgeting and Quality Assurance trainings are an added value and some may be treated as conditional for this role.
Professional membership of associations related to the Aviation/Airlines industry is a plus.
Very good written and verbal communication skills: reporting, presentations, etc.
Fluent in English and French
Moroccan Nationality is a must
 

Work Experience
-    5+ years’ related working experience in a similar role handling technical procurement in the Engineering Department in the Aviation industry; low cost airline is an advantage.
-    Specialized industry knowledge in procurement & inventory management systems, acquisition & Contract management.
-    Possesses appropriate knowledge of the legal requirements of the respective Civil Aviation Authority
-    Experienced in Vendor relationship: tender submissions, contracts, and SLAs of technical nature.
-    Developed skills in cost-estimation analysis and managing budget.
-    Experienced in working with a team of professionals (Engineers and Technicians) in a frequently changing environment with heavy work-load schedules and ad-hoc scenarios.
-    Experienced in implementing, and monitoring policies, procedures and operating manuals as per business needs and in line with adopted regulations and approved quality standards.
-    High accuracy and attention to both results and details.
-    Proven skills in analyzing data, identifying variations and recommending cost-effective solutions.
-    Cost-oriented, possesses analytical thinking, persuasive, problem solving, and decision making skills.
-    Employs technical expertise, and interpersonal relations to support company’s objectives.
-    Demonstrates the ability to contribute and successfully deliver against business strategy and set KPIs.

companie: Concentrix Corporation
intro:
Job Title:

Salesforce Business Analyst-Rabat
description:
Job Description

We’re Concentrix, the global tech and services powerhouse helping the world’s top brands simplify, modernize, and transform how they connect with people. We’re intelligence-fueled and tech-powered — and we’re looking for a Salesforce Business Analyst to join our team in Rabat.

In this role, you’ll bridge the gap between business needs and smart technology solutions. You’ll analyze, optimize, and design Salesforce features that boost performance, drive adoption, and fuel digital transformation.

Career growth and personal development

At Concentrix, we invest in our people because when you thrive, our clients and customers thrive. You’ll have access to specialized training, industry certifications, and growth programs designed to support your career journey, every step of the way.

In fact, most of our managers and leaders have been promoted from within.

What you will do in this role

As a Salesforce Business Analyst, you will:

Collaborate with business stakeholders to analyze, define, and document Salesforce-related requirements.
Translate business needs into scalable Salesforce solutions, ensuring alignment with industry best practices.
Work with developers and administrators to customize and optimize Salesforce functionalities (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, etc.).
Support CRM implementation projects, system integrations, and data migration.
Develop and maintain detailed process flows, wireframes, and functional documentation.
Conduct user training & support, Ensuring successful implementation and adoption of new features.
Stay updated with the latest Salesforce releases, trends, and best practices.
Your qualifications

We welcome team players who are curious, driven, and ready to make an impact.

Concentrix is a great match if you have:

Experience: 3+ years as a Salesforce Business Analyst, Consultant, or a similar role.
Salesforce Certifications: Salesforce Administrator, Salesforce Business Analyst, or other relevant certifications (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, etc.).
CRM Expertise: Strong background in CRM implementation & optimization, preferably in Salesforce ecosystem.
Technical Knowledge: Understanding of APIs, REST/SOAP integrations, data migration, and Salesforce automation tools.
Agile Mindset: Experience with Agile/SAFE methodologies and working in cross-functional teams.
Communication Skills: Ability to translate business needs into clear functional requirements for technical teams.
Problem-Solving Skills: Strong analytical mindset with the ability to propose innovative solutions.
Not sure if you meet every requirement? That’s okay — we’d still love to hear from you. We believe diverse experiences create stronger teams.

Here’s what we offer:

Full-time, indefinite contract
Hybrid or remote work setup in Rabat
Competitive salary and performance bonuses
Opportunities to work on global Salesforce innovation projects
Certification and career advancement support
Training on the latest CRM trends and tools
Collaborative, diverse, and supportive environment
Referral bonuses and internal mobility options
Power the best version of you!

Join our community of 440k+ game-changers across the globe and shape what’s next. If this role sounds like your next big move, we’re ready for you.

inwi est un opérateur digital global, couvrant l’ensemble des services des télécommunications au Maroc. Services Voix (fixe et mobile), Internet et Data à très haut débit à destination du grand public et des entreprises.

Pour cela, l’opérateur peut capitaliser sur la qualité de ses infrastructures 4G, Fibre Optique, ADSL et l’Internet par satellite pour raccorder rapidement le plus grand nombre.
Ce que vous ferez :


En tant que Chargé(e) de Gestion Opérationnelle des Comptes vous avez pour vocation de Gérer un portefeuille de clients B2B Stratégiques et Haute Valeur à partir de la prise de commande, en s’assurant de la bonne prise en charge de ses requêtes,  à travers la coordination et le suivi de traitement avec les différentes entités internes, ainsi que l’apport d’un feed-back au client dans les délais fixés .
 Ainsi, vos principales missions sont:
Veiller au bon traitement des requêtes clients par l’analyse détaillée, le suivi rigoureux avec les entités internes et la réponse efficace et rapide. Effectuer des visites client, pour faire le suivi des requêtes traitées, pour assistance ou support technique mobile ou Data Mobile. Etablir un suivi détaillé et personnalisé des requêtes et commandes clients de son portefeuille
Votre parcours professionnel et académique:


De formation Bac+4 en commerce, Marketing et/ou Relation client, avec une expérience de 3 ans minimum dans une fonction similaire.

### Des réductions exclusives négociées

# Analyste Risques Opérationnels – Accès Marchés Financiers
Banque de financement et d'investissement

Casablanca, Région de Casablanca-Settat, Maroc

Référence 2500099L
Date de début Immediately
Date de publication 18/04/2025
Le titulaire du poste rejoindra la cellule « accès marchés » au sein de l’équipe EDO (Electronic Orders & Data Oversight) du pôle MARK/BTO/ORM. L'objectif de cette cellule est d’assurer l’enregistrement & le suivi de tous les accès des traders & sales de la banque d’investissement aux différentes bourses internationales.
Vous serez amené à travailler en étroite collaboration avec tous les acteurs de la banque d’investissement à savoir, les traders, les vendeurs, les ingénieurs etc.
Vous serez en charge des tâches suivantes :
Participation aux différents projets en tant que sponsor, coordinateur ou contributeur MARK (projets de remédiation, recommandations d’audits, etc…) Mise en place / adaptation de la gouvernance MARK autour des accès marchés Exécution et coordination des contrôles liés aux accès marchés Réalisation et coordination de la production des reportings adéquats Interagir en bonne intelligence avec les différentes fonctions de support ou de contrôle de la banque, en s’assurant d’un bon alignement des priorités et d’une coopération fructueuse. Veille technologique et réglementaire
La capacité à initier ou implémenter des améliorations de processus (contrôles, automatisation, simplification, homogénéisation, augmentation de la qualité et organisation de comités) est un facteur clé de succès
De formation Ecole d'ingénieur / Ecole de commerce / Master en ingénierie financière
Vous disposez d'une expérience de 5 ans minimum en analyse de risque / gestion de projet en lien avec la finance de marchés et des réglementations en vigueur (notamment MIFID, EMIR…) dans un environnement finance de marché.
Curiosité, Rigueur, capacité d'adaptation à un environnement en évolution constante, une bonne communication, une faculté à anticiper les risques et faire preuve de proactivité, sont des qualités nécessaires à la réussite dans ce poste.
Créée en 2014, SG ATS est une filiale du Groupe Société Générale qui fournit des solutions agiles et efficaces aux salles des marchés SG en Europe (principalement à Paris et Londres) afin de les aider à se développer et à répondre aux exigences de plus en plus fortes imposées par les différentes législations bancaires internationales. 
Forte de son succès, SG ATS ambitionne de devenir un centre multi-services, toujours en fournissant des prestations à forte valeur ajoutée à différentes lignes de métiers du Groupe sur des activités de marchés, mais également à la direction des risques, la direction financière, la direction de la conformité et à d’autres directions centrales. 
Sacrée « Meilleur Employeur 2023 – Maroc » SG ATS est une structure jeune, dynamique qui positionne le capital humain au centre de son développement. SG ATS souhaite donc s’entourer de talents qui participeront activement à la réussite de l’entreprise tout en évoluant dans un environnement international propice au développement de compétences à forte valeur ajoutée.
« Les informations recueillies sur ce site font l’objet d’un traitement destiné à répondre aux besoins de recrutement de la société SG ATS. Ces données sont traitées par les services internes de la société. Conformément à la loi n° 09-08 promulguée par le Dahir 1-09-15 du 18 février 2009, relative à la protection des personnes physiques à l’égard du traitement des données à caractère personnel, vous bénéficiez d’un droit d’accès et de rectification aux informations qui vous concernent, que vous pouvez exercer en vous adressant à donnees-personnelles.sgats@sgcib.com .Vous pouvez également, pour des motifs légitimes, vous opposer à ce que les données qui vous concernent fassent l’objet d’un traitement. Ces données peuvent faire l’objet d’un transfert à l’étranger. Ces traitements ont été notifiés et autorisés par la CNDP sous les numéros A-RH-354/2016 et T-RH-129/2016.
